alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 11:02AM MDT until June 12 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Colfax County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 400 PM MDT. * At 1102 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated several thunderstorms moving northeast over the same areas with heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen overnight and early this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vermejo River, Ponil Creek, Cimarron River, Rayado Creek, Chicorica Creek, Eagle Tail Creek, the Canadian River, Raton, Springer, Cimarron, Maxwell, Raton Crews Airport, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Philmont Scout Ranch. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 304 and 360. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 412 and 460. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
